subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Skiing
lead_paragraph: Ivica Kostelic of Croatia won a World Cup slalom Monday for his second podium finish in two days on the Gran Risa course in Alta Badia, Italy. The top American finisher was Ted Ligety, in 12th place. Bode Miller split a gate during the opening run and was disqualified. Kostelic won with a combined time of 1 minute 39.83 seconds. He placed second in the traditional giant slalom Sunday, his best result in the discipline.
